title: Augmented Reality-Based Science Learning Design: Applying Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic science concepts and fundamental smartphone operation skills
context.additional_context: A 30-something professional responsible for elementary science education in a non-PC environment, requiring the development and application of AR learning content via smartphone apps.

learning_goals: Learners can spatially represent scientific concepts using AR (Augmented Reality) technology
Learners can effectively integrate multimedia elements (text, images, sound) in augmented reality environments to explain learning content
Learners can simulate scientific experiment processes and improve result prediction accuracy by over 70% through AR-based microlearning modules

resources: AR Content Creation Tool (e.g., Unity + Vuforia)
Quiz Platform for Measuring Learning Effectiveness
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
